intro: Voacanga havilandii, commonly known as the African ivory tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and dense, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by bright red, fleshy berries containing black seeds. Voacanga havilandii is notable for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
